result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James R. Wolfe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James R. Wolfe was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Wolfe

defendant.name: Wolfe, James R.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
03:06 pm - Defendant James R. Wolfe in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant James R. Wolfe in custody.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea quesitonnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Rielly/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence
Court Costs remitted
Jail 60 days - Jail credit 60 days
Appeal rights given
State's Reply to Discovery continued  and State's Demand for Discovery

09:38 AM - Defendant James R. Wolfe in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant James R. Wolfe in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

02:43 pm - Defendant James R. Wolfe in court, via video,  with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant James R. Wolfe in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Rielly motion to modify bond currently $3500 cash bond.  Currently on probation hold.  Court will take under advisement.  Prelim time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.

01:55 pm - Defendant James R. Wolfe in court, via telephone from Oneida County jail, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
